title: Automakers Retool Marketing Machines as They Go Electric
summary: Range is the new horsepower and sustainability the new status symbol as electric cars move toward mass production. Coming soon: a vegan interior.

title: Egypt Looks to Offshore Gas Field for Growth and Influence
summary: A natural gas discovery could bolster the economy and revive the country’s regional clout. But Egyptians battling unemployment and inflation might gain little.

title: The Great American Cardboard Comeback
summary: “No one is shocked when a paper mill closes anymore. The shocking thing is when one reopens.”

title: Shell Sees New Role for Former Steel Region: Plastics
summary: The oil and gas company is returning to the polyethylene market, building a 386-acre plant on the site of a long-shuttered zinc smelter on the Ohio River.

title: He’s No ‘Sycophant’ for Trump, Expected Fed Nominee Says
summary: In an interview, Stephen Moore maintained his view that rate increases were wrong, but said he regretted his harsh criticism of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome H. Powell over them.

title: Saudi Aramco to Buy $69 Billion Stake in Petrochemical Company
summary: The oil company’s investment in Sabic will infuse money into a Saudi sovereign wealth fund after a planned initial public offering of Aramco faltered.

title: Wow Air, an Icelandic Budget Airline, Suspends Service
summary: Efforts to raise money had failed, prompting the company to cease all flights on Thursday morning.

title: Saudi Aramco Is World’s Most Profitable Company, Beating Apple by Far
summary: Earnings at Saudi Arabia’s giant oil company, at $111 billion last year, far outstripped the profits of giant tech companies or rival oil producers.

title: Japan Stumbles as China’s Growth Engine Slows
summary: A slump in exports raises questions about how effective Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s economic policies would have been without Chinese help.

title: Blamed for Climate Change, Oil Companies Invest in Carbon Removal
summary: Chevron, Occidental Petroleum and BHP have invested in Carbon Engineering, a start-up developing technology to take carbon out of the atmosphere.

title: Demand for Saudi Aramco Bonds Sails Past the Goal
summary: Despite concerns about the company’s ties to Saudi Arabia and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, Aramco is the world’s most profitable company, and investors want a piece of it.

title: Trump Signs Orders to Speed Up Oil and Gas Pipeline Construction
summary: The president wants to limit the influence of state governments and the State Department in approving domestic and international pipelines.

title: Algerians Stage Largest Protest Yet, Rejecting President’s Offer
summary: Tens of thousands of anti-government protesters packed the streets of the capital, rejecting President Abdelaziz Bouteflika’s offer not to seek a fifth term.

title: ‘It Is Unspeakable’: How Maduro Used Cuban Doctors to Coerce Venezuela Voters
summary: President Nicolás Maduro sent doctors door-to-door to warn the ill and elderly that care would be cut off unless they voted for the governing party, said 16 Cuban physicians who worked in Venezuela.

title: ISIS Caliphate Crumbles as Last Village in Syria Falls
summary: American-backed forces took the last remnant of territory under Islamic State rule in Syria, but signs of the group’s resurgence are already visible.

title: ‘It’s Time to Break the Chains.’ Algerians Seek a Revolution.
summary: The demonstrations in Algeria have grown larger every week and now seem unstoppable. The protesters demand the ouster of not only President Bouteflika, but his entire system.

title: Algerian Leader Bouteflika Resigns Under Pressure From Army
summary: The state news agency said the ailing Abdelaziz Bouteflika, who hasn’t spoken to his countrymen in seven years, was stepping down.
